game.name: Le Grec
game.history: Invented by Dominique Huguenin and Yves Chédel. Belongs to the Halma family of games.
game.board: 3x3 grid of intersections (4x4 nodes including edges); players start on two opposite ranks (7 pieces each).
game.pieces: Seven white counters vs seven black counters; place at nodes, no captures.
game.tomove: Move one of your pieces per turn. Moves may go orthogonally or diagonally into an empty adjacent node. Jumps over a single opposing piece are allowed if the landing spot is empty. There are no captures. Movement must be forward, relative to the player's start side and never backwards, or sideways.
game.towin: be first to occupy the two rows opposite your start side with all seven pieces. Variant-specific win conditions apply when no moves remain.

strategy.name: Force a Stuck Position
strategy.description: Force your opponent to a stuck position or yourself depending on the win condition of the variant chosen.

strategy.name: Avoid Draws
strategy.description: This game is quite draw heavy. Most of the time the graph will show a draw situation. Try to play forward with as many pieces as possible to increase your chances of not getting stuck and put pressure on the opponent.

variant.name: Advancement Comparison/Regular
variant.description: If a player has no moves, the player with more pieces in the opponent's goal rows wins; ties count as losses for the stuck player.

variant.name: Stuck Player Wins
variant.description: When a player to move has no legal moves, that player wins (the opponent caused the stuck state).

variant.name: Stuck Player Loses
variant.description: When a player to move has no legal moves, that player loses (they caused the stuck state).
